{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = This isn't true.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:06.480
    | text      = So unfortunately, in 1991, anthropologist Walter van Beek led a team to live among the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:29.119
    | text      = So that was in 1952.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:30.960
    | text      = At 13 years after this gathering, Young would tell a 20-year-old Robert Temple about the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:35.839
    | text      = French anthropologist's findings with the Dogon people, and almost certainly added a
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:40.079
    | text      = little bit of his own wacky spin to it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:42.400
    | text      = People who have studied the supporting documents and the book Temple ended up writing have
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:45.920
    | text      = concluded, based on how weak it is on evidence, that he must have been writing it to please
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Hey, hey, man.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:55.200
    | text      = Hey, I wrote this book for you.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:58.079

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = of this helicopter, and he's like, my boss loves fucking Sirius aliens.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:06.079
    | text      = He's told me about this article about the Dogon having contact with aliens and creating
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:11.599
    | text      = civilization.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:12.400
    | text      = I'm going to fucking reinforce it in this book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:15.039
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:15.359
    | text      = So Temple, by brown-nosing his way into a helicopter, wound up creating an entire fucking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:22.880
    | text      = mythology behind these assholes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:23.440
    | text      = He wasn't alone in it, because there's still Eric von Daniken and shit like that.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:28.000
    | text      = A lot of those people...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:28.880
    | text      = I don't know exactly how the timeline works, but it's not like...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:31.839
    | text      = Well, neither do they, because the aliens control it, Dan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:35.119
    | text      = But it's not like he's singularly responsible for a lot of this stuff.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:41.200

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:42.000
    | text      = So that might make it a little bit of a surprise to learn that, on the cover of the Sirius
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = find any mistakes in this book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:55.359
    | text      = He did not write that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:56.640
    | text      = He did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:57.200
    | text      = Did he?

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = He did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = As like a piece of literature?

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:08.400
    | text      = But this seemed like too much.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:10.240
    | text      = It's a little bit much.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:11.279
    | text      = A little bit much.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:12.640
    | text      = It turns out Asimov later clarified what was going on here.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:16.079
    | text      = Quote, he sent me the manuscript, which I found unreadable.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:19.440
    | text      = Finally, he asked me point blank if I could point out any errors in it, and partly out
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:26.319
    | text      = of politeness, partly to get rid of him, and partly because I had been able to read very
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:30.960
    | text      = little of the book, so the answer was true.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:33.680
    | text      = I said I could not point out any errors.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:40.720
    | text      = I'll just have to be careful hereafter.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:45.519
    | text      = That is perfect.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = That is a perfect story.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:52.240
    | text      = Like getting that blurb on the cover of the book is obviously lending his work false credibility.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:57.279
    | text      = Well done.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = So this entire interview and the basis for Pierre's supposed scholarship boil down to

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = two phenomenon in the study of language that Pierre would be much more aware of if he actually

    | text      = studied languages he pretends to be an expert in.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:27.199
    | text      = These are what's known as false cognates and false friends.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:30.559
    | text      = There are tons of examples of words in different languages that sound similar and often even
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:34.559
    | text      = have similar meanings but it'd be wrong to say that they're connected because they come
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:38.159
    | text      = from completely distinct etymological bases.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:40.960
    | text      = This is what's called a false cognate.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:43.119
    | text      = One of the most common and famous examples of this is the word dog being the same in
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:48.400
    | text      = English and in the aboriginal Bahrambam languages despite there being no relation between the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:54.480
    | text      = two cultures that would explain this commonality.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:56.960
    | text      = What you have to consider is that every language contains thousands and thousands of words.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:01.119
    | text      = So while it seems impossible the two cultures would come up with the same name for the same
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:04.719
    | text      = thing given the huge vocabularies you're looking at it's bound to happen in some cases just
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:09.920
    | text      = on a probabilistic basis.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:11.840
    | text      = What's important here is that these things are understood by people who study linguistics
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:16.480
    | text      = because they consider the etymology of the words and how these languages are formed and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:21.199
    | text      = where the influences come from.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:23.119
    | text      = It's not something that's mysterious and completely lost to us.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:27.119
    | text      = And a false friend is Alex Jones to Joe Rubkin.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:30.079
    | text      = It's a sneaky snake.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = It's a sneaky snake.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:31.679
    | text      = There are words in languages that look like they're connected and sound very similar but
}}

    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:35.920
    | text      = mean completely different things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:37.760
    | text      = These are what's known as false friends and they're often a result of languages borrowing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:41.920
    | text      = words from a shared source language and then tweaking the meaning over the course of time.
